title: Exploring the antidepressant potential of Drymaria cordata Willd. ex Schult - A comprehensive review.
abstract: Depression is a complex and debilitating mental health disorder with significant biological, social, and personal well-being. Drymaria cordata Willd. ex Schult (D. cordata) is a medicinal herb traditionally used in folk medicine to treat various ailments, including headaches, convulsions, bronchitis, and ocular disorders. It has also demonstrated several central nervous system (CNS)-related activities, such as anxiolytic, analgesic, anti-nociceptive, antitussive, and anti-amnesic effects. These properties suggest a possible role in neuropsychiatric modulation, warranting exploration of its potential relevance to depression.
